SEARCH

Class Main

java.lang.Object
Main
public class Main extends Object
The `Main` class serves as the entry point for the Number Guesser game. It manages the game flow, including initializing the game environment, handling player interactions, and maintaining player scores across sessions. The class includes methods for loading and saving player data, managing game difficulty, and handling user input and output.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main (String[] args) throws IOException
      The main method to start the Number Guesser game. Initializes the game environment, loads player data, and manages game flow.
      Parameters:
      args - Command line arguments
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input or output exception occurs

    • getValidDifficulty

      public static int getValidDifficulty (Scanner sc)
      Prompts the user to select a difficulty level and ensures the input is valid.
      Parameters:
      sc - Scanner object for reading user input
      Returns:
      The selected difficulty level as an integer

    • gameStart

      public static void gameStart (Player player, RNG random, Set<Player> playerList, int difficulty)
      Starts the game for the given player with the specified difficulty and random number generator.
      Parameters:
      player - The player object
      random - The RNG object for generating numbers
      playerList - The set of all players
      difficulty - The difficulty level of the game

    • getFail

      public static void getFail (int guess, int tries, int result, Player player, int difficulty, Set<Player> playerList)
      Handles the scenario when the player's guess is incorrect. Provides feedback and updates the player's score if no tries are left.
      Parameters:
      guess - The player's guess
      tries - The number of tries left
      result - The correct number to guess
      player - The player object
      difficulty - The difficulty level of the game
      playerList - The set of all players

    • getSuccess

      public static void getSuccess (int tries, Player player, int difficulty, Set<Player> playerList)
      Handles the scenario when the player's guess is correct. Awards points based on the number of tries left and updates the player's score.
      Parameters:
      tries - The number of tries left
      player - The player object
      difficulty - The difficulty level of the game
      playerList - The set of all players

    • save

      public static void save (Set<Player> playerList) throws IOException
      Saves the current state of the player list to a file.
      Parameters:
      playerList - The set of all players
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input or output exception occurs

    • updateList

      public static void updateList (Player player, int difficulty, int points, Set<Player> playerList)
      Updates the player's score and difficulty level in the player list.
      Parameters:
      player - The player object
      difficulty - The difficulty level of the game
      points - The points to be added to the player's score
      playerList - The set of all players

    • load

      public static Set<Player> load() throws IOException
      Loads the player data from a file and returns it as a set.
      Returns:
      A set of players loaded from the file
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input or output exception occurs

    • showPlayerScore

      public static void showPlayerScore (Set<Player> playerList, Player player, boolean isRetry)
      Displays the player's score before and after the match. If the match is a retry, it shows the post-match score; otherwise, it shows the current score. Handles cases where the player is new or the first player ever.
      Parameters:
      playerList - The set of all players
      player - The player object
      isRetry - Indicates if the current match is a retry

    • playerExists

      public static Player playerExists (Set<Player> playerList, Player player)
      Checks if the player already exists in the player list and returns the player object.
      Parameters:
      playerList - The set of all players
      player - The player object to check
      Returns:
      The existing player object if found, otherwise the new player object

    • errorHandler

      public static void errorHandler() throws IOException
      Redirects error messages to a text file for logging purposes.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input or output exception occurs
